entry.title: Leveraging SAP Reference Architecture for Event-Driven Application in Missing Part Fulfilment Busine
entry.content:
Introduction

In the era of Industry 4.0, the ability to respond to real-time events in industrial production is crucial for operational efficiency. This blog outlines a proof of concept (PoC) that demonstrates how Airbus leveraged SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), and Events-to-Business Actions Framework to automate and orchestrate the missing part fulfillment process within production operations. The solution leverages an event-driven architecture to automate business processes based on missing part fulfillment in real-time.

This architecture is highly repeatable and can be applied to a wide range of SAP scenarios such as plant maintenance, purchase requisitions, inventory updates, and more, making it a valuable reference for enterprises looking to scale event-driven integrations. 

Engagement

The outcome described in this article was facilitated by custom adaptation of the Events-to-Business-Actions Framework by Airbus and was supported by SAP OCTO Team under PVN Pavankumar

Business Scenario : Missing Part Fulfilment in Production

The use case centres on streamlining the missing part fulfilment process within Airbus production operations. It begins when a missing part is detected for a work order reservation in the SAP ECC backend, which supports day-to-day production activities. From that initial identification, the process continues all the way through to the confirmation of the work order operation.

Throughout this journey, the workflow leverages an event-driven architecture (EDA) to track progress in real time, integrating seamlessly with backend systems. SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) orchestrates collaboration between all involved actors by sending out forms and notifications, gathering approvals, and automating decisions based on predefined business rules. Additionally, the PoC highlights the real-time monitoring and dashboarding features of SAP Build Process Automation, ensuring end-to-end visibility across the process.

This PoC showcases how we made that happen. 

Solution Architecture

Below is the architecture diagram representing the technical landscape for the missing part fulfilment process.

Figure 1: End-to-end architecture of the Airbus missing part fulfillment solution using SAP BTP, Advanced Event Mesh, E2B Framework, and custom Node.js applications.

Technical Implementation 

This architecture leverages key components across SAP BTP, Advanced Event Mesh, and custom applications to create a robust event-to-action pipeline: The Solution Architecture is illustrated in Figure 1, and the important components along with their connectivity are explained below:

-> Business events are triggered:
Different actors interact with the SAP backend (supporting production operations). Transactions such as work order reservations, purchase orders, or outbound deliveries generate relevant business events.

-> Events are routed to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh (AEM):
These events are sent to SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh‚Äîeither directly or via Solace event brokers in Airbus Private Cloud, especially if events need to be shared with other platforms.

->  Event-specific queues manage the flow:
Within SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh, specific queues collect events related to predefined topics, pushing them into the Events to Business Actions (E2B) framework.

->  Business logic and workflows are triggered:
E2B calls SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) APIs to:

  • Apply decision rules and determine what business action should occur based on the event payload,
  • Launch new workflow instances,
  • Update waiting tasks on running workflows,
  • Push events to visibility scenarios for process monitoring.

->  Backend queries for richer context:
E2B also calls backend APIs to fetch more information related to business objects‚Äîsuch as:

  • Details of a reservation linked to a purchase order,
  • The specific station tied to a work order reservation,
  • The list of actors involved, leveraging Responsibility Management in SAP S/4HANA based on attributes like station.

->  Traceability with PartsNow:
PartsNow, is a custom SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP,Node.js) application, used to persist the relationship between workflow instance IDs and related work order reservation IDs. E2B registers new workflow instances and can retrieve instance details as needed via PartsNow APIs.

->  Unified user experience in SAP Build Workzone:
SAP Build Workzone serves as the entry point for business actors, providing:

  • My Inbox: For completing tasks such as form fills or approvals,
  • My Processes: For real-time workflow monitoring,
  • Process Visibility Dashboard: To track KPIs and process efficiency,
  • Studio Home: Where process specialists can manage BPA decision rules.

->  Automated notifications and integration points:
Finally, SAP BPA calls remote APIs to:

  • Inform the PartsNow app about workflow instance completion,
  • Send email notifications to relevant actors via an SMTP server.

 

Developer Insights

As a developer building this PoC, a few key learnings stand out:

  • Loose coupling using SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh and queues ensures resiliency and scalability.
  • Decision capability in SAP Build Process Automation allowed us to externalize complex logic from the app code, making it easier to maintain and extend.
  • Using SAP BTP Destinations and Service Bindings helped standardize secure backend access across environments.

Deployment Steps

Follow this GitHub documentation for detailed steps for configuration and deployment.

 

Closing Remarks

We hope this blog has inspired new ideas for applying event-driven automation to your own business processes.

Refer to SAP Architecture Centre and Events-to-Business-Actions Framework Repository for implementation details. 

Thanks to colleagues from SAP OCTO Team Praveen Kumar Padegal and Swati Maste for their support.

entry.title: SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications
entry.content:
Agentic AI application development is fundamentally reshaping the way business applications are designed, developed, and delivered. AI-powered assistants and copilots are rapidly becoming an integral part of the development process, helping teams to boost productivity, reduce errors, and innovate faster than ever.

Meeting Developers Where They Are

SAP is committed to meeting developers where they‚Äôre at ‚Äì that means no matter where or how you code, you have the freedom to choose the environment that best suits your needs and access to the tools that maximize your productivity and impact.

To that end, I‚Äôm excited to share that SAP is introducing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to boost development with the following technologies:

  1. Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP)
  2. SAP Fiori Elements 
  3. SAPUI5 

By adopting these new MCP standards, developers can seamlessly extend SAP‚Äôs development capabilities into multiple environments, ensuring flexibility and choice. SAP Build now enhances popular IDEs and AI coding assistants such as Cursor, Windsurf, Github Copilot, Cline and Claude Code.

We are also excited to share that the MCP Servers are being released as an open-source projects, licensed under the Apache-2.0 license. This marks another step in our commitment to openness and community-driven innovation. Learn more about Open Source at SAP.

What is an MCP?

MCP is an emerging open standard that allows AI models and tools to interact in a structured, secure, and consistent way. MCP acts as a universal bridge between an AI coding assistant with an LLM and external tools, data, and workflows ‚Äî so the model can seamlessly fetch context, take actions, and deliver more accurate, useful results. MCP gives developers the ability to integrate their tools with the broader AI ecosystem while receiving the right assistance, at the right time, without switching contexts.

The Value of SAP MCP Tools

While many AI tools generate code, SAP takes this a step further by ensuring that what‚Äôs generated provides a solid foundation for building enterprise-grade applications. The MCP tools delivered by SAP are backed by our technology teams and designed specifically for SAP Business Applications. This means:

  • Best Practices Built-In: Generated code with CAP, UI5 and Fiori elements code already provides you with the right starting point for reaching SAP standards and proven design guidelines.
  • Guided Development: Developers receive recommendations and guardrails tailored to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
  • Consistency:  SAP‚Äôs MCP tools are and will be reused across our tooling portfolio, ensuring consistent developer experience and outcomes wherever you build SAP applications. Whether you‚Äôre generating backend services, UIs, or business logic, you can rely on the same quality, structure, and compliance.

Scaling AI Agents with SAP Expertise

One of the most powerful aspects of MCP adoption is the ability to upscale AI agent chat capabilities with deep SAP application development expertise. This means that AI copilots and agents can go beyond generic code suggestions to provide context-aware, SAP-specific guidance. Whether you are working with Vibe Coding tools on the web or coding directly in your IDE of choice, MCP brings value to everyone ‚Äî from casual and junior developers to senior professionals. It enables you to build enterprise-grade SAP applications with confidence, while seamlessly combining AI-driven assistance with SAP‚Äôs trusted frameworks, best practices, and tooling to maximize productivity.

 

Looking Ahead

These are exciting times to be a developer. The combination of AI and open standards like MCP is rewriting the rules of software development. At SAP, we are committed to keeping our developer community at the forefront of innovation. By investing in AI-powered tools and standards, we ensure that you‚Äîour developers‚Äîhave everything you need to build, scale, and innovate with confidence. üöÄ

entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì Blog #1 in the Series
entry.content:
Organizations around the world are migrating their databases to the cloud, striving to increase operational efficiency, performance, and scalability while reducing costs. But not all databases are created equal.

SAP HANA Cloud is a cloud-native, in-memory database that delivers high performance, scalability, and powerful analytics. It lets you store, process, and query various types of data and models in a single system. Developers can build and deploy intelligent applications, rapidly and at scale. These are just a few of the reasons why so many companies have moved to SAP HANA Cloud.

The value is clear. In a recent study,[1]  IDC found that large enterprises could realize an annual average value of US$13.7 million by using SAP HANA Cloud. This benefit equates to $820,000 per SAP HANA Cloud database per year, with a three-year ROI of 352%. Isn‚Äôt that impressive?

The promise of SAP HANA Cloud is attractive for organizations considering a database migration. But you still need to make your business case to justify a modernization initiative.

To help you develop your argument, I‚Äôve created this blog series on the top 10 benefits of migrating to SAP HANA Cloud. In each blog, I‚Äôll review some of the key features and capabilities of SAP HANA Cloud and explore how each one can help your organization realize critical business value. Let‚Äôs get started.

Multi-model engines

No enterprise relies on only one type of data. Depending on your business, you may be using relational, geospatial, graph, JSON, and vector data, for example. This data can be structured, semi-structured, or unstructured, including text and multimedia content. Some organizations funnel data into single-purpose databases that handle only certain data types. But that database specialization creates additional costs, management effort, and complexity.

SAP HANA Cloud handles diverse workloads within a unified system‚Äîprocessing relational, geospatial, knowledge graph, time series, and vector data for AI applications. This ability to support multi-modal AI, where systems comprehend and process information from various data types, adds versatility. Application developers can integrate diverse data sources into a single application with ease and users can query and blend diverse data types intuitively. Multi-modal AI also reduces the need for complex ETL processes between systems.

The multi-model capabilities of SAP HANA Cloud deliver value by improving productivity. Developers can accelerate the development of AI-infused intelligent applications thanks to native support for predictive modeling, similarity searches, and graph analysis. By reducing the barriers to business data access and enabling faster, more informed decision-making, SAP HANA Cloud can speed up decision-making and improve overall business effectiveness.

Considering these benefits, IDC calculated that SAP HANA Cloud could enable overall productivity gains of 18%, creating an annual business value of $7.8 million. In the study, one entertainment industry executive summarized how the database delivered value for his company.

‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud is a more modernized system that has resulted in time savings for developers, analytics, and administration because of the robust integrated tools provided, templates, and modelling capabilities,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud has enabled my organization to make better business decisions and build better models, which drives business growth.‚Äù

Read more to build your business case

Multi-model engines are just one feature of SAP HANA Cloud that can accelerate your organization‚Äôs journey to modernization while reducing costs and maximizing efficiency. The following blogs in this series review additional capabilities that can help you build your business case while preparing for the future of modern, intelligent applications and processes.

Watch out the next blog, which discusses SAP HANA Cloud‚Äôs infrastructure independence and next-generation application foundation.

Additional resources:

Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.

Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.

Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

[1] . ‚ÄúThe Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,‚Äù IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.title: SAP Partners - Fast Track your SAP Business Technology Platform Certification Path
entry.content:
SAP Business Technology Platform Certification Path ‚Äì From Beginner to Advanced

Are you interested in getting your SAP Business Technology Platform ( SAP BTP)  certification, but unsure of where to begin?

In this blog, we would like to give you a better overview of the available SAP BTP certifications and guide you how to progress from foundational level to professional expertise. Additionally, we will introduce several enablement offerings, specifically designed for SAP Partners,  that can help you fast track your SAP BTP certification. 

Depending on your existing knowledge and skills, you can determine which of the three steps below is the ideal starting point for you.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 1- Entry-Level Certification

For partners who are new to SAP‚Äôs ecosystem, one of the best starting points to learn the basics of SAP Business Suite and the importance of SAP BTP is the entry level certification ‚ÄúPositioning SAP Business Technology Platform as part of the SAP Business Suite‚Äù.

This certification takes you through the foundational courses of the SAP Business Technology Platform, enabling the enhancement of business processes through the integration of intelligent technologies, the development of innovative applications, and the analysis and visualization of data.

  • For SAP Partners, we offer bi-weekly 90 minutes webinars that are led by SAP experts and will provide the clarity, focus, and key insights you need to approach the certification exam with confidence. Access the latest schedule. 

 

Step 2- Get Specialized with the Associate Level Certifications

 If you already have the foundational knowledge in SAP BTP, you can delve into specialized certification tracks based on their career goals and interests. Professionals choose from distinct areas, including Application Development and Automation, Integration Database and Data Management, and AI Foundation. Each specialization offers focused certifications and provide the skills required to address specific business needs and technical challenges, equipping learners with the knowledge to advance their SAP careers.

For SAP Partners , you can join one of the Partner Get and Stay Certified Academies below that will help you with the certification exam. 

  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Security Administrator
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Backend Developer ‚Äì CAP
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for SAP Build ‚Äì LCNC
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Integration Developer
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Backend Developer ‚Äì ABAP Cloud

 

Step 3 - Become a SAP BTP Solution Architect

Experienced professionals can pursue the SAP BTP Solution Architect professional certification. From a career development perspective, this certification is marking the transition from a specialized skillset to a broader, strategic role. Solution architects are responsible for designing comprehensive SAP BTP implementations that align with business objectives and technical requirements.

entry.title: Introducing Reporting Scope and Data Collection in SAP Sustainability Control Tower
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog post reflects the state of the SAP Sustainability Control Tower as of September 1st, 2025.

Why SAP Developed Reporting Scope and Data Collection

SAP introduced the Reporting Scope and Data Collection feature in Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) to address the challenges organizations face when manually collecting sustainability data. Many customers struggled with decentralized, manual processes ‚Äì often relying on emails and spreadsheets ‚Äì which made it difficult to ensure data quality, traceability, and compliance with regulatory requirements. The new feature provides an integrated, workflow-based solution that guides users through the process, ensures relevant KPIs are collected, and supports collaboration between central and local teams. 

What Does the Feature Do?

The Reporting Scope and Data Collection feature enables organizations to:

  • Define which sustainability metrics are relevant for reporting.
  • Configure how data should be collected and who is responsible.
  • Guide users through a structured, form-based workflow for data entry, review, and approval.
  • Track and manage data collection runs for different reporting periods.
  • Ensure data is captured, approved, and stored in a traceable manner. 

Step-by-Step Guide: SAP SCT Applications

  1. Manage Reporting Scope
  • Define the scope of sustainability reporting by selecting relevant metrics and organizational boundaries.
  • Set validity dates and add comments for each metric (e.g., materiality, monitoring purposes).
  • Capture the results of double materiality assessments and specify which KPIs require data collection.
  • In this simplified example the organizational boundary is set to Business Region EMEA and the Scope Items are the ESRS items Total energy consumption related to own operations - E1-5 - (37)(AR 35) and Total water consumption - E3-4 - (28a).

  1. Configure Data Collection
  • Assign data processors and approvers for each scoped metric and organizational entity.
  • Choose the data collection method (e.g., workflow-based).
  • Ensure responsibilities are clear for each data point to streamline collaboration

  1. Configure Data Entry
  • Customize the data entry form for each metric, including the data collection cycle (e.g., monthly, quarterly or yearly) and required breakdowns by a master data dimension.
  • Add instructions and enable relevant dimensions to guide processors during data entry

  1. Manage Data Collection Instances
  • Set up data collection runs for specific reporting years and periods.
  • Define start, submission, and approval dates to control the workflow timeline.
  • Generate forms for each reporting period and metric, ensuring timely data collection. 

  1. Manage Data Collection Forms
  • Preview and send out data collection forms to assigned processors.
  • Processors enter data and submit for approval; approvers review, approve, or reject submissions.
  • Approved data is published and stored, with full traceability in SCT. 

 

This new workflow-based approach in SAP SCT streamlines sustainability data collection, improves data quality, and supports compliance with evolving regulatory standards.

Feature status and outlook: Currently, the feature supports quantitative metrics and measures for sustainability reporting. In future iterations, SAP plans to include qualitative metrics and basic custom metrics, as well as additional data entry methods, plausibility checks, multi-step approvals and email notifications based on customer feedback.

For further support, please also visit Data Collection Workflow for Quantitative Metrics | SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: IPS provisioning to ABAP Cloud Developer Trial
entry.content:
This is my test in setting up IPS to provision user and groups to my Cloud ABAP developer Trial system which is on my home docker.

My test scenario, I have

  1. A Cloud Identity Service in US East region
  2. my BTP subaccount in US East region
  3. Subscribed to Cloud Identity Services Connectivity Plan in my BTP subaccount
  4. I have my Abap Cloud Developer 2023 trial system running on docker
  5. Configured the Cloud Connector in the docker to connect to my BTP subaccount

Since I don‚Äôt have a Corporate iDP proxied in my Cloud Identity Service (SCI) , I will use the SCI identity stored as my iDP (user store)  and IPS source.  The goal is to be able to provision the user and groups in IAS into my ABAP Cloud Identity.

So, roughly it will look like this.

 

This is important for IPS to be able to access the RFC destinations in that subaccount. The subaccount needs to be in the same region as the IPS tenant.

Note that trial version of Cloud Identity Services will not work with on-premise as it does not come with "Connectivity plan". See blog.

Some notes about SCI plans.

  • 3326943 - Cloud Identity Services - Plan Type
  • 3211854 - "Connectivity Plan" is not visible in BTP Service Marketplace
  • 3537257 - Error occurred when subscribing default/additional/connectivity plan for Cloud Identity Service

The rest of the configuration, follow the sap help documentation that provided a concise step by step procedure that includes setting up IAS/Cloud Connector/Tenants/ABAP role/ABAP Technical user/RFC Destinations:

How to connect Identity Provisioning with IAS as the source and S/4 HANA On-Premise as the target

Instead of repeating the steps, I'll put screenshots of my setup.

My Setup Screenshots

BTP Subaccount

 

SCI connectivity plan subscribed.

Cloud Connector on docker

Cloud Connector is available in BTP subaccount

 

Cloud Connector is active

Subaccount RFC Destination to Cloud ABAP on-premise

 

IPS Source:

 

In my example, ias.user.filter parameter is used to filter to just one test user.

The recommendation is to filter based on your needs and not provision every groups and users,  which might overwhelm the ABAP system with unnecessary users.  

IPS Target:

 

 

 

Lessons learned:

  1. Cloud Identity Service must not be NEO. 
  2. Subaccount tenant for the on-premise system must be in the same region as the Cloud Identity Service.
  3. Connectivity Plan is needed for the subaccount with the on-premise RFC destinations.
  4. IAS group provisioned as Business Role in ABAP, not in SUGR. The business Role must exist in ABAP for it to be provisioned to the user.
  5. IAS user must have a Login Name. This is mapped to user field in SU01.

 

Hopefully these learnings and screenshots will help the community.

entry.title: New Learning Journey Integrating SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 with SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hey SAP CX Community! It's Fernando here, checking in!

Over the past few years, we've been creating numerous educational resources focused on integration topics for SAP Sales and Service Cloud version 1.  From this year on, our upcoming focus will be on version 2 extensibility and integration topics. Today, we are thrilled to announce in this blog post the next major learning milestone for those looking to master the integration of SAP Sales and Service Cloud version 2 with SAP S/4HANA.

Join me in welcoming our newest addition to the SAP's learning platform: 


New Learning Journey 
Integrating SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 with SAP S/4HANA

If you're an integration developer looking to prepare for integrating SAP Sales and Service Cloud version 2 with SAP S/4HANA using Cloud Integration, you've come to the right place. Here, you'll gain the practical knowledge needed to manage the entire end-to-end integration project.

We've structured our content to ensure that, after finishing this learning journey, integration developers, administrators, and consultants will have the skills to set up, configure, and implement the integration between SAP Sales and Service Cloud version 2 and SAP S/4HANA for master data replication.

Here's a sneak peek of how it appears:

Audience
The course is meant to be helpful for:

  • Integration Developers
  • Technical Consultants
  • Administrators
  • Architects

Learning Objectives
After completing this learning journey, integration developers and technical consultants will gain an overview of the fundamental technical aspects, architecture, and scenarios for the integration between SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2, and SAP S/4HANA. You will be able to develop end-to-end integration between these systems based on identifying involved systems, exploring integration scenarios, preparing your system landscape, performing the master data replication procedure, and gaining skills on monitoring and troubleshooting techniques.

Learning Content
The learning journey consists of 6 units and provides more than 8 hours of content:

  • Introducing the Integration of SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 with SAP S/4HANA
    This unit introduces SAP Sales and Service Cloud integration with SAP S/4HANA, covering SAP's integration strategy, involved systems, standard scenarios, and the course's scope..
  • Preparing Technical System Settings
    Covers the preparation of technical system settings for integrating SAP Sales and Service Cloud with SAP S/4HANA, including detailed system landscape exploration, communication settings, credential setup, integration package configuration, trust establishment, and Cloud Connector configuration.
  • Preparing Functional Dependencies in SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2
    This unit focuses on preparing functional dependencies in SAP Sales and Service Cloud, including examining object dependencies, understanding external ID mapping and code list maintenance, and setting up code list integration using Incoterms as an example.
  • Setting Up and Running Product Replication from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2
    Teaches how to set up and run product replication from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Sales and Service Cloud, including configuring communication settings, integration flows, web services, and executing the replication process.
  • Setting Up and Running Business Partner Replication from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2
    This unit covers setting up and running business partner replication from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Sales and Service Cloud, including configuring communication settings, integration flows, service groups, data replication framework, business partner confirmation, and executing the replication process.
  • Monitoring Messages and Troubleshooting
    Last unit on monitoring messages and troubleshooting in the integration process between SAP S/4HANA and SAP Sales and Service Cloud, including identifying monitoring tools, analyzing common issues, and resolving them effectively.

After completing successfully this Learning Journey you'll be granted with a digital badge like this one which could be shared and linked to your social networks:

 

 

 

 

 

Give it a try! We plan to create more extensibility learning content for SAP Sales and Service Cloud version 2, and we'd appreciate your feedback on whether these lessons are useful for you or your team.

Additional Resources
There is a related live session for . You can find more free learning journeys at the , where you can build in-demand SAP skills for variety of topics specifically the SAP CX Solutions portfolio. If you are more in for quick video learning, then, look for our videos Integration and Extensibility videos for SAP Customer Experience to get updates on the latest integration and extensibility videos for SAP Customer Experience solutions.

You can find a related live session onStarting with SAP Integration Suite for Customer Experience. For additional free learning journeys, visit the SAP Learning site for Integration and Extesibility to build in-demand SAP skills on a variety of topics, for the SAP CX Solutions portfolio. If you enjoy quick video learning, explore our Integration and Extensibility videos for SAP Customer Experience for the newest updates on integration and extensibility for SAP Customer Experience solutions.

entry.title: SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary - bigger and better than ever
entry.content:
Come see SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) at this year‚Äôs SAP Connect / Success Connect event in Las Vegas! Due to the ever-increasing interest in SAP BTP topics and our sessions in prior years having standing-room only attendance, SAP BTP has more sessions than ever before! We even have for the first time ever, not one, but two hands-on-labs!

SAP BTP topics for 2025

This year‚Äôs SAP BTP for HR experience at SAP Connect is all about more. More business scenarios, more technology, more platform - more BTP! This year‚Äôs topics include customer favorites such as integration, extensibility and automation as well as numerous SAP SuccessFactors product-led sessions about how SAP BTP helps them deliver better solutions making it easier for customers to streamline HCM processes. Additionally, as we see an increase in technical audience members, we‚Äôll be featuring slightly more
technical product deep dives by the product teams (also a first for us!).

Demos and hands-on labs

Demo-station demo: Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding, featuring Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh

We‚Äôre showcasing two demos at the ‚ÄúIntegration and Extension with SAP BTP‚Äù demo station. The first is our popular Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding demo which shows SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs Advanced Event Mesh event-driven integration capabilities to provide automated equipment ordering. This dramatically reduces the amount of time a people manager spends ordering equipment as well as requesting access to systems and data. If you missed this demo in Lisbon last year, then this is your chance!  Included are:

  • See how we used SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to analyze onboarding processes to identify key areas to address inefficiencies: hiring manager ordering of equipment, waiting for responses from people via email
  • SAP Integration Suite and advanced event mesh which offers real-time triggering of data synchronization based on SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central event triggers
  • An example app an IT department can create to offer pre-bundled packages of equipment to make it easier for managers to pick equipment, and to standardize offerings
  • One-click approvals by the hiring manager, powered by SAP Build 
  • Automatically submitting equipment selection to SAP Ariba guided buying via SAP Integration Suite
  • Notifications pushed to the task center for the hiring manager via SAP Build
  • Automatic submission of support tickets to SAP Service Cloud for manual tasks like requesting access to systems and data


Demo-station demo: Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo and hands-on lab

Additionally, we‚Äôre showing our brand new Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo which is specifically designed for more technical HRIS audiences in collaboration with the SAP SuccessFactors team. 

This demo is also the basis of two, 75-minute hands-on labs we‚Äôre offering this year which are sure to sell out! The lab will walk non-technical novices and intermediate technical knowledge people (non-developers, IT and HRIS are our target audience) on how to use SAP Build to quickly and easily create a mobile app with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central people data to offer location-specific benefits for a field office ‚Äì all with no coding, using SAP Build‚Äôs powerful drag-and-drop development interface. We‚Äôll have product experts from the SAP Build team presenting and explaining to the audience the different capabilities of SAP Build in a follow-the-presenter format from their own workstations in live SAP Build environments so everyone will be able to walk away with direct product knowledge of what‚Äôs possible.
Included in the session:

  • Overview of the low-code SAP Build environment
  • Overview of various content types, controls, functions available
  • Adding content and configuring to the controls
  • Using an integration to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central for people data
  • Accessing benefits information in the employee profile via API
  • Customizing the look and feel of the app
  • Testing the app and deployment

View the hands-on lab in the event catalog: Hands-on lab: Creating a custom mobile app for HR using SAP Build solutions (limited capacity) | HCM1677

There‚Äôs also quick overview videos of both these demos on the SAP.com/btp-for-HR page as well!

 

SAP BTP-led sessions

Integration sessions


Maximizing HCM process efficiency with integration through SAP BTP | HCM1665

Discover how SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Integration Suite enable integrations for SAP SuccessFactors HCM, automating tasks and processes. entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 with SAP Incentive Management for Real-time Incentive calculation
entry.content:
Integrating SAP Sales Cloud V2 with SAP SuccessFactors Incentive Management creates a powerful solution for real-time incentive calculation and sales performance optimization. Here's a breakdown of how this integration works and the benefits it offers:

Integration Overview

The mashup between SAP Sales Cloud V2 and SAP SuccessFactors Incentive Management enables sales teams to:

  • View real-time incentive data directly within the Sales Cloud interface.
  • Access a unified dashboard showing opportunities, leads, commissions, and payouts.
  • Receive instant updates as deals progress, with incentive data refreshed in real time.
  • Gain actionable insights into how performance affects earnings and what actions can maximize incentives.

Key Benefits

  1. Real-Time Insights & Motivation

    • Sales reps can see their commissions and performance metrics instantly.
    • Features like commission estimates, leaderboards, and performance dashboards help boost motivation.

  2. Streamlined Dispute Resolution

    • One-click traceability allows quick resolution of compensation inquiries.
    • Reduces administrative overhead and keeps reps focused on selling.

  3. Optimized Incentive Plans

    • Use AI-driven recommendations to refine compensation strategies.
    • Identify opportunities for bonuses or accelerators to maximize ROI.

  4. Flexible Plan Design

    • Easily model and test complex incentive plans using drag-and-drop tools.
    • Roll out new promotions without heavy IT involvement

Implementation Highlights

  • Once integrated, users can navigate to Sales History ‚Üí Opportunities in SAP Sales Cloud V2.
  • A new dashboard section appears showing incentives and payments.
  • The mashup is enabled via standard configuration steps provided by SAP.

Integration Flow Description

  1. SAP Sales Cloud V2

    • Opportunity is created and assigned to a Opportunity Owner (Sales Employee).
    • Opportunity data includes total revenue,opporuntiy date, product, and stage.

  2. Employee Sync

    • The Employee in Sales Cloud is synced with SuccessFactors via master data integration.
    • Employee is linked to a Position in Incentive Manager.

  3. SuccessFactors Incentive Management

    • The Position is mapped to an Incentive Plan.
    • Incentive Plan defines rules, rule elements including quotas, accelerators, and payout logic.

  4. Real-Time Calculation

    • As the Opportunity progresses, incentive calculations are triggered.
    • Sales reps can view estimated commissions, performance dashboards, and leaderboards directly in Sales Cloud.

  5. Feedback Loop

    • Incentive results are sent back to Sales Cloud for visibility.
    • Managers can adjust plans or resolve disputes using traceable data.

entry.title: SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

I'm thrilled to introduce you to something completely new in the SAP events landscape: SAP Connect 2025, our groundbreaking annual event for business leaders that highlights how businesses maximize their SAP investments and accelerate transformation.

You've invested significantly in SAP solutions across your organization. Your CHRO relies on SAP SuccessFactors for talent management, your CPO uses SAP Ariba to optimize procurement, your CMO leverages SAP Customer Experience solutions to drive engagement, your CFO depends on SAP S/4 Finance to keep the business running, and your COO manages supply chain demand with SAP Integrated Business Planning. But here's the challenge every C-suite leader faces‚Äîhow do you connect your organization‚Äôs disconnected landscape so you can move beyond implementation to true business transformation?

 

 

Beyond Software: Your Partner in Business Success

While SAP is fundamentally a software company, our mission extends far beyond delivering technology. We empower business leaders, whether you're a CHRO building world-class teams, a CPO driving procurement excellence, a CMO creating customer loyalty, a CFO optimizing financial performance, or a COO ensuring operational excellence, to achieve transformational business outcomes.

The reality is that technology alone cannot be the sole factor in innovation. It's the strategic implementation and utilization of that technology that is aligned with your specific business challenges and opportunities that creates measurable value. SAP Connect 2025 is designed around this fundamental truth:

Your business outcomes are our primary measure of achievement.

 

 

The Reality Check: Where Most Organizations Stand Today

The 2025 C-Suite survey by Thomson Reuters Institute identified the following as the key challenges that currently hinder the effectiveness of enabling functions within organizations:

  1. Ineffective data and information flows between different departments
  2. Time-consuming compliance and reporting tasks
  3. Staffing and resourcing challenges, and
  4. Poor data quality and structure.

 

Do any of them sound familiar? Regardless of your role and vertical, these challenges continue to be roadblocks to achieving short- and long-term success for today‚Äôs businesses.

 

 

What Makes SAP Connect Different: Connect Everything, Achieve Anything

If you‚Äôre a seasoned business leader with SAP events, you‚Äôll notice that it‚Äôs looking a little different this year. Unlike the previous years of offering separate events for each department, SAP Connect is now one unified event with five specialized experiences, each designed for a specific department. This clearly illustrates the connection between SAP Business Suite and how these solutions work together to drive enterprise-wide value.

Each Connect event delivers deep, dedicated content while maintaining a connection to the broader SAP Business Suite ecosystem. You'll walk away with concrete strategies tailored to your specific business challenges.

 

 

How does the SAP Business Technology Platform fit in SAP Connect?

It couldn‚Äôt be more fitting! Like this year‚Äôs theme of ‚ÄòConnect everything. Achieve anything‚Äô, SAP Integration Suite within SAP Business Technology Platform is the answer to cross-organization connectivity. Integrating your across SAP and third-party applications allows you to build, extend and automate with SAP BuildÔøºmore to bring value to the business. Also, with prebuilt integration packages and AI-assisted features, the ROI can be achieved more efficiently. And of course, we can't forget about AI! With SAP Joule tailored for your developers' needs, you can generate code, automate processes, design intuitive UIs, and build custom agents using AI.

Customer example: CITIC Pacific Mining Management Pty Ltd. integrated SAP SuccessFactors applications, then used SAP Build to automate document digitization in a safe and compliant way via their mobile web app. This eliminated manual information collection, entry, and validation, keeping the data always up-to-date and compliant. entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì Blog #2 in the Series
entry.content:
In my previous blog, I discussed how SAP HANA Cloud delivers critical business benefits to organizations that migrate their database to the cloud. Advanced features such as multi-model engines allow enterprises to increase productivity and reduce complexity. In a recent study,[1]  IDC calculated that large enterprises can realize an annual average value of US$13.7 million by using SAP HANA Cloud.

Understanding how the specific capabilities of the database benefit your organization is key to helping you justify a cloud modernization initiative. Let‚Äôs look at two more capabilities that can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud: infrastructure independence and a next-generation application foundation.

Infrastructure independence

Your database requirements constantly evolve. To keep up with changing business conditions, customer requirements, and user demand, you need an infrastructure that matches your needs. A solution that offers vendor independence is key.

SAP HANA Cloud offers multi-cloud flexibility so you can run on your hyperscaler of choice. The cloud-native architecture runs on Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Alibaba Cloud, and soon, SAP data centers. You can choose a hyperscaler without fear of vendor lock-in.

 

Because it uses cloud-native technologies, the architecture offers consistent, high performance no matter which provider you choose. Automated failover and recovery features enhance resilience. Database administrators can provision new instances in just minutes. And elastic scaling capabilities respond to changing workload demands in real time.

SAP HANA Cloud also reduces the complexity of database operations. It simplifies integration across hybrid or multi-cloud environments and provides direct access to data in SAP applications. Because SAP HANA Cloud is a fully managed database-as-a-service (DBaaS) from SAP, your IT personnel are free to focus on value-added tasks. What‚Äôs more, SAP HANA Cloud covers your database, infrastructure, and management requirements, eliminating the need for a separate infrastructure contract with your hyperscaler.

The IDC study assessed the financial impact of infrastructure independence and the associated flexibility. After deploying SAP HANA Cloud, study participants reported a 33% efficiency boost for their infrastructure teams and said that database deployments were executed 38% faster. Considering the costs of IT staff management, unplanned downtime, and database infrastructure, IDC calculated a 35% lower annual total cost of ownership for SAP HANA Cloud over a three-year period.

According to one study participant with a large database environment,

‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud has enabled us to redirect IT staff to focus more on the production environment, new development, integration, and leveraging AI. Overall, this allows them to help drive revenue and increase productivity.‚Äù

Next-generation application foundation

To gain business value from modern, intelligent applications, you need a sophisticated database that can support multiple data types from various sources, process data in real time, and deliver insightful analytics.

SAP HANA Cloud is part of SAP Business Technology Platform, an open cloud platform with data management, analytics, AI, IoT, blockchain technologies and application development services. Together, SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP form a full-stack solution that includes powerful integration features and an intuitive interface, all under one commercial model.  In addition, SAP HANA Cloud is the trusted database that powers SAP‚Äôs mission-critical solutions, such as SAP Business Cloud, with multi-model engines and enterprise-grade performance and reliability.

SAP HANA Cloud also empowers developers to create intelligent applications using today‚Äôs most advanced technologies. With this database, teams can build applications that use generative AI, machine learning, and specialized engines to handle vectors, knowledge graphs, property graphs, and spatial processing. It also manages semi-structured JSON data with ACID compliance. The resulting applications are context-aware and offer secure connections to critical business data and curated data products from SAP.

This integrated approach allows applications to ingest and process data in multiple formats and from various sources, including SAP and third-party solutions. Users get live access to critical business information without data replication. Native connectivity to various data sources unifies disparate data streams, offering a single holistic view of your enterprise data. Applications can respond to events in real time, support automated processes, and enable ad-hoc decision-making using current and historical data.

 Having a next-generation application foundation adds IT, performance, and business enablement benefits, according to the IDC study. After adopting SAP HANA Cloud, participating organizations realized a 33% efficiency boost for their infrastructure teams. Query speed and response time increased by 31% and 29%, respectively. Enterprises processed 151% more data sources and 77% greater data volume (in terabytes) than in previous environments. Business operations improved, thanks to enhanced analytics that led to better business decisions, an accelerated application development process, and more agile deployment of database resources. Participants also realized end-user productivity gains of 18%, leading to annual gross revenue gains of nearly $40 million per organization.

A study participant who works in the healthcare industry summarized the value of SAP HANA Cloud.

‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud provides my organization the ability to apply parallel processes and maintain scalable databases,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAs a result, we have been able to build a lot of applications with machine learning and AI capabilities. With SAP HANA Cloud, it is easier to integrate these applications.‚Äù

Explore other SAP HANA Cloud features to build your business case

Read the next blog to learn how multi-dimensional elastic scalability and intelligent data tiering features in SAP HANA Cloud can help you build your business case while preparing for the future of modern, intelligent applications and processes.

 

Additional resources:

What‚Äôs the potential value of SAP HANA Cloud for your organization? Complete a short assessment. 

Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.

Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.

Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

[1]  ‚ÄúThe Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,‚Äù IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.content:
‚ú®ü™Ñ Revellio ü™Ñ‚ú®

                                                                                                      üåüüîÆüßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü™Ñ‚ú®üßù‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüåü

                                                        ‚Äú Unveiling the secrets of Identity Federation, one step at a time‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ú®üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Unlocking SAP IAS Attribute Magic: Default vs Enrich Secrets Revealed üé©

About Me

Hare Krishna üôè I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

üåüIntroduction

When integrating SAP SaaS products on BTP, managing user attributes becomes a big challenge. Every app expects something slightly different‚Äîfrom hardcoded values to custom claim names. Without IAS, you'd have to tame these discrepancies in every corporate IdP or app individually, which isn't sustainable.

üîëIAS centralizes this with:

  1. üü¶ Default Attributes

  2. üü© Enrich Assertion Attributes

  3. ‚öôÔ∏èIdentity Federation controls which method is applied

üìòConcepts: When Which Mechanism Applies

Default vs. Enrich Assertion Attributes

SAP IAS provides two methods to control how attributes are sent to applications:

1. üü¶ Default Attributes

  • Configured at the application level inside IAS.

  • Can be static (hardcoded), pulled from IAS user store, or derived.

  • ‚úÖUsed when Identity Federation is enabled.

2. üü© Enrich Assertion Attributes

  • Configured in the corporate IdP connection inside IAS.

  • Uses values from the upstream IdP, with transformation before sending to apps.

  • ‚úÖUsed when Identity Federation is disabled.
    (üìÑ Official Doc)

üîÑIdentity Federation in IAS

Identity Federation decides whether IAS acts as the authoritative IdP üÜî or a proxy üîÄ:

  • Federation Enabled

    • IAS processes üü¶ Default Attributes.

    • Useful even when using corporate IdP‚ÄîIAS can inject hardcoded values like Groups = sac.

  • Federation Disabled

    • IAS functions as a pass-through proxy.

    • Only üü© Enrich Assertion Attributes are active, customizing only based on the upstream IdP data.
      (üìÑ Reference)

üí°This flexibility ensures SAP SaaS tools always receive what they expect‚Äîwithout demanding changes in your corporate IdP or each app.

üåüHow IAS Helps Customers

Setting up SSO for SAP SaaS apps can be tricky‚Äîeach service has its own attribute requirements. Without IAS, you‚Äôd constantly tweak your corporate IdP or each app.

With Default and Enrich Assertion Attributes, IAS provides a centralized layer to standardize attributes once and reuse across apps.

üîëReal-World Scenarios(few examples)

SAP ServiceRequiredHow IAS helps
Datasphere / SAC üìäGroups = sacA retail company can inject this via Default Attribute to authorize analysts without changing Azure AD groups.
Signavio üüßsignavio_groupsA manufacturing firm maps workspace groups via Enrich Assertion when federation is off, or as Default Attribute when federation is on‚Äîno IdP restructuring needed.
Kyma Runtime üåÄGroups as groupsA tech startup transforms incoming Group claims from Okta to groups for app provisioning without any code changes.
SAP BTP Services üî∑firstname, lastname, emailA logistics company ensures consistent user attributes from IAS or upstream IdP for automated user provisioning.

üí°Customer Value

  • Less Customization: Corporate IdPs remain clean; no per-app hacks.

  • Faster Rollouts: Onboard new SAP tools quickly.

  • Compliance & Governance: Centralized attribute control improves auditability.

  • Flexibility: Hardcode, map, or enrich attributes depending on SaaS needs‚Äîwithout breaking federation.

Whether it‚Äôs Datasphere, Signavio, or Kyma, IAS ensures your SSO setup just works, letting IT teams focus on business instead of identity headaches.

‚öôÔ∏èConfiguring Attributes in IAS ‚Äî Step-by-Step

Here‚Äôs how to set up each mechanism using the IAS Admin Console üñ•Ô∏è:

1. üü¶ Configure Default Attributes (for Federation Enabled)

  • Navigate to IAS Admin Console ‚Üí Applications.

  • Select your application (e.g., üìä Datasphere).

  • Go to Trust ‚Üí Assertion Attributes / Default Attributes.

  • Add Default Attribute:

    • Example: Groups = sac (hardcoded value)

    • Or map values: ${user.firstName}, ${user.company}

  • üíæSave and exit.
    (üìÑ Doc)

2. üü© Configure Enrich Assertion Attributes (for Federation Disabled)

  • Go to IAS Admin Console ‚Üí Identity Providers ‚Üí Corporate Identity Providers.

  • Select your corporate IdP (e.g., Microsoft Entra ID logo üîµ).

  • Open the Assertion Enrichment tab.

  • Add mapping rules:

    • Example: ${user.email} ‚Üí emailAddress

    • Example: ${customAttribute1} ‚Üí employeeNumber

  • üíæSave the configuration.
    (üìÑ Doc)

3. üß™ Test and Validate

  • Use IAS‚Äôs Test tool üß∞ or a SAML tracer üîç.

  • Confirm:

    • üü¶ Default Attributes appear with Federation Enabled.

    • üü© Enrich mappings appear with Federation Disabled.

üì∏Real-Life Example (Screenshot Placeholder) 

üèóÔ∏è Architecture: IAS as Proxy (OIDC ‚Üî SAML)

entry.title: Why People Come Before Process and Technology in the SAP BTP Journey
entry.content:
When people talk about SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) or any transformation project, the conversation often begins with technology‚Äîdata models, extensions, integrations, and AI. But in my experience, the real magic of BTP doesn‚Äôt just come from its capabilities; it comes from the people who gather around it.

A platform becomes powerful when it inspires collaboration. That‚Äôs where community building comes in. Whether you‚Äôre a developer, architect, or business user, being part of a thriving community accelerates learning, drives adoption, and sparks innovation in ways no single project team can achieve alone.

Who I Am

I‚Äôm SAP BTP DevOps & AI Manager at Bluestonex (member of the SAP AppHaus Network), a mentor guiding SAP Tech professionals at Modish Tech (my own digital brand), and a trustee for The Sanatan Parivar charity, aiming to bring communities together.

I‚Äôve been fortunate to see SAP BTP evolve from its very beginnings, and I‚Äôm thankful to the organisations I worked for‚Äîand continue to work with‚Äîfor allowing me to explore it right from when it was first introduced. 

My passion lies in bridging innovation with community impact‚Äîusing technology not just to solve business challenges, but also to empower people. Over the years, I‚Äôve seen how focusing on people first changes the trajectory of projects, communities, and careers.

If you‚Äôd like to continue the conversation or just say hello, you can find me on LinkedIn.

Now, back to the topic...

Technology Is Only Part of the Equation

SAP BTP offers incredible capabilities that reshape business operations. But these tools are only as effective as the people who imagine, build, and sustain them. Without shared understanding, collaboration, and knowledge transfer, even the most advanced solutions risk becoming underutilised‚Äîor worse, becoming that ‚Äúcool proof of concept‚Äù everyone forgets about six months later.

The People-First Advantage

So what does ‚Äúpeople first‚Äù look like in the SAP BTP journey?

  • Confidence Through Enablement ‚Äì These days, enablement is the key. With an ever-changing tech stack‚Äîand especially in the SAP ecosystem, where constant branding and rebranding often push older content into the bin‚Äînewcomers are left confused about where to start. Classic example is SAP Integration Suite in the community is known by different names, CPI, IS, CI... everyone has their own version. We still refer Work Zone as the launchpad.  These are just few examples, I hear a lot from my mentees. This is why consistent enablement matters. Without it, people struggle to build confidence; with it, they can navigate the shifts, embrace the new, and grow faster.
  • Knowledge Sharing ‚Äì Empowering teams through open discussions, blogs, and mentorship ensures that expertise doesn‚Äôt sit in silos. It's easy to explore technology and build a proof of concept individually. But if we multiply this, it's even more powerful. This means everyone in a team is doing it, think about the productivity and work delivered by  the team.
  • Collaboration Over Isolation ‚Äì The best BTP outcomes I‚Äôve seen came from cross-functional teams and communities working together, not from lone experts. Let's be real, you cannot do everything on your own. You need people with expertise in different areas. 
  • Innovation Through Conversation ‚Äì Some of the most creative BTP use cases I‚Äôve seen didn‚Äôt start with a specification sheet; they started with people brainstorming and challenging each other. An example of this is the SAP BTP Monitor, which the team at Bluestonex delivered when we had nothing where we can see the SAP BTP consumption. Now SAP have come up with this option in the cockpit. There are many gaps, and people at Bluestonex fill these gaps with apps, all that starts with a conversation!

Rethinking the Balance

Process and technology will always matter‚Äîbut they‚Äôre accelerators, not starting points. When you put people first, you create an environment where processes can adapt and technologies can scale. Skip the people, and you risk building solutions that look great on paper but struggle in practice.

Building a Community That Lasts

That‚Äôs why community matters so much in the SAP BTP journey. Communities create ecosystems where growth is mutual‚Äîwhere experts share not just what they know, but also lift others to succeed. By doing so, they multiply value far beyond what technology alone can deliver.

This is why I‚Äôve chosen to write here. My goal is to contribute to a community where knowledge flows openly and people feel empowered to innovate together. In future posts, I‚Äôll share practical ways to accelerate BTP learning and adoption, grounded in the belief that people must always come first.

Join the Conversation

SAP BTP will continue to evolve, but one principle remains constant: people drive progress.

So, I‚Äôll leave you with this question: In your SAP BTP journey, how have people made a difference?

Your story might be the one that inspires someone else to grow. And if nothing else, you‚Äôll save someone from endlessly googling ‚ÄúIs it still called SAP Cloud Platform or‚Ä¶?‚Äù üòâ

entry.title: Kickstart Your SAP BTP Journey
entry.content:
All you need to know and where to start

You may have come across articles, presentations, interviews or discussions about SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). You heard the term quite often, but you might still be asking:  

  • What exactly is SAP BTP?
  • Why is SAP BTP important?
  • And how do I begin exploring SAP BTP‚Äôs potential?
  • How does SAP BTP fit into the clean core strategy?

You‚Äôre now at the right place.

Whether you're a decision maker looking to drive IT strategy, an IT professional building solutions, a business user focused on innovation, or part of the academic community exploring cutting-edge technologies, this post is your launchpad into the world of SAP BTP.

Curious where you fit in? Keep reading to discover the tools, learning paths, and support SAP BTP offers for every IT role: from developers and architects to students, educators, and decision makers.

No matter your background or goals, there‚Äôs a starting point tailored just for you.

 

What We‚Äôll Cover Here

  1. What Is SAP BTP?
  2. Why SAP BTP Matters
  3. SAP BTP and clean core
  4. Try Before You Buy: Trials & Pricing Models
  5. Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?
  6. SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role
  7. Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates
  8. Start building today!

 

What is SAP BTP?

SAP BTP is an intuitive, modern development and innovation platform for both professional IT and business users. It is a unified platform that brings quickly together everything you need to build any idea or business vision to life, extending, and integrating existing business applications, whether they‚Äôre SAP or not.

With self-service data discovery, modeling, planning, and analytics for business users in a governed environment, it provides integration solutions to connect and streamline applications and processes across the entire enterprise, offering pre-built business content like built-in data products, integrations, workflows, app templates, and AI services.

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs in the toolbox:

  • App Development & Automation: Rapidly develop applications or automate processes using low-code/no-code tools or opt for professional-code development when advanced customization and control are required
  • Data & Analytics: Turn your data into decisions with built-in analytics and planning tools.
  • Integration: Connect SAP or non-SAP systems like a pro.
  • Artificial Intelligence: Infuse AI into your workflows, apps, and decisions.
  • Platform Foundation: Secure, scalable, and ready for hybrid cloud environments.

Simply put, SAP BTP enables you to innovate and stay relevant by building on established foundations.

 

Why SAP BTP Matters?

Because digital transformation is not just a trend, it‚Äôs essential for adaptability and resilience, a.k.a. survival.

With SAP BTP, you can:

  • Automate repetitive tasks and free up time for real work.
  • Connect all of your systems, so they integrate.
  • Build custom apps tailored to your business needs and vision.
  • Use AI to make smarter decisions, faster.
  • Connect and harmonize all your data, eliminating data silos
  • Get mission-critical insights from your data without a background in data science

And the best part? You don‚Äôt have to start from scratch.
SAP BTP offers thousands of pre-built content packages, from application or automation templates to integration flows to dashboards to AI services.

 

SAP BTP and clean core

Clean core is a set of guiding principles that support continuous business transformation by designing agile, innovative and efficient ERP systems. The principles focus on building resilient business processes and extensions supported by seamless integration, efficient operations, and data quality.

Central to the clean core strategy are Side-by-side extensions, powered by SAP BTP.

Side-by-side extensions allow organizations to enhance their SAP landscapes without directly modifying the core SAP S/4HANA system: instead of embedding custom code within the core, new functionalities, integrations, and custom applications are developed and deployed independently on SAP BTP.

This approach leverages SAP BTP's robust services, including various runtime environments (like Cloud Foundry, Kyma, and the ABAP Environment), development tools (like SAP Business Application Studio and CAP), and critical integration services (like SAP Integration Suite and SAP Event Mesh). Connectivity is securely handled by tools like the SAP Cloud Connector for on-premise systems and the Destination Service, ensuring seamless data exchange via standard APIs and business events from the core.

 

Try Before You Buy: Free Trials & Flexible Pricing Models
Not ready to commit? No problem

SAP BTP offers a 90-day free trial with access to 30+ services.

You can explore, experiment, and learn at your own pace how to build, deploy, and integrate with a full suite of platform services.

Start here your free trial of SAP Business Technology Platform.

When you're ready to scale, you‚Äôve got options:

  • Free Tier: Build small apps, pay only for what you use.
  • Pay-As-You-Go: Great for dynamic needs and innovation projects.
  • Enterprise Agreement: Predictable pricing for known use cases.

Explore all the possibilities SAP BTP unlocks. We‚Äôve outlined the opportunities below:

 

Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?

Thousands of organizations, from global enterprises to emerging startups, are already leveraging SAP BTP to transform their operations. Let their success inspire you.
They are using SAP BTP to:

  • Automate supply chains
  • Personalize customer experiences
  • Streamline HR processes
  • Build AI-powered finance tools ... and achieve much more.

With over 33,000 customers and 3,200 partners, you'll be in excellent company.

See how SAP BTP customers are achieving a measurable impact across industries and lines of business.

 

SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role

Here‚Äôs your go-to list of resources to get rolling, matched to your role:

Note: This table is a starting point. Resource-role mappings are suggestions. Feel free to explore beyond your role based on your needs and interests. Find below what each of the resources has to offer.

SAP Discovery Center - Learn about SAP BTP Services in detail:

  • Start your experience with Guided Missions to bring real life use-cases to life
  • Reference established architectures patterns to guide your design and implementation
  • Understand how SAP BTP‚Äôs AI capabilities are used to infuse AI features into SAP‚Äôs solution portfolio
  • Create an estimate of your services to get a first impression about the usage cost.

SAP BTP Learning - Free learning journeys tailored to your role and pace:

  • Familiarize yourself with the basic concepts of SAP BTP.
  • Get enabled.
  • Plan your implementation.
  • Prepare for your go-live.

SAP BTP Guidance Framework - Provides a central access point for architects, developers, and administrators to build and run enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP:

  • Decision Guides: Quickly identify the best technology options for your specific needs.
  • Reference Architectures: Explore solution templates to effectively design and build on BTP, understanding key concepts and capabilities.
  • Methodologies: Access guided approaches to boost your cloud technology maturity, spanning both technical and organizational aspects.
  • Technology Recommendations: Evaluate and choose the right implementation options across various technology domains.
  • DevOps Principles: Empower your development and operations teams to achieve greater efficiency.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub  - Kickstart your projects with ready-to-use Business Content available for SAP BTP:

  • Integration: Access over 4,000 pre-built objects, including integration flows, scripts, value mappings, and message mappings, to streamline your connections with SAP Integration Suite
  • Development & Automation: Accelerate your projects with approximately 650 pre-built workflows, automations, applications, templates, and actions ready for use with SAP Build
  • Analytics: Jump-start your data insights using pre-built dashboards, stories, and data models specifically designed for SAP BTP's analytics capabilities
  • Information: Explore a rich repository of resources, including APIs, events, CDS views, business objects, interfaces, adapters, process blueprints, and SAP-validated partner use cases.

SAP Community - Connect with fellow SAP BTP users, ask questions and share ideas, get help and help others.

 

Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates

SAP Release Navigator - Keep up with the latest innovations and updates across SAP BTP, track new features and plan your adoption.

Road Map Explorer - Discover SAP‚Äôs product strategies and planned innovations with this go-to interactive tool. It highlights key advancements and offers a robust planning horizon, helping you precisely detail your transformation journey.

Strategy White Paper for SAP BTP - When you are ready to get deeper, discover more with SAP‚Äôs strategy for SAP BTP.

 

Start Building today!

Start your journey today with the SAP BTP Trial or explore your first mission at the SAP Discovery Center.

Got further questions? Drop them below and let‚Äôs build something amazing, together.
